text: Polaris Pro Grappling is Europe's longest running large-scale professional grappling event. As of November 2019 Polaris has organized 12 events featuring both Gi and Nogi matches all of which have been held in the UK. Polaris has attracted some of the biggest names from Brazilian Jiu-jitsu, Grappling and Mixed Martial Arts including Keenan Cornelius, Michelle Nicolini, Brad Pickett, Rousimar Palhares, Dean Lister, Masakazu Imanari, Ikuhisa Minowa, Vítor Ribeiro, Fernando Terere, Caol Uno, former Strikeforce Middleweight Champion Jake Shields and former UFC Lightweight Champion and WEC Lightweight Champion Benson Henderson. Former UFC Welterweight competitor. Dan Hardy and UFC referee Marc Goddard are listed as event judges. Polaris have received positive feedback in the Jiu-Jitsu press for the high quality of their events and the talent they have been able to attract to compete. They have also been praised for their treatment of the athletes competing as well as the diversity of styles and match ups they have been able to put together. Polaris main bouts are 15 minutes in duration with preliminary bouts lasting 10 minutes. Matches are not points based with competitors able to win either via submission or judges decision. ==Current Polaris Title Holders== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Division ! This event featured three world title fights. The card was headlined by the current Polaris middleweight Champion Craig Jones and the former IBJJF champion Keenan Cornelius in a match to crown the inaugural Polaris Light Heavyweight Champion. It was a rematch from their fight at ADCC 2017, which Cornelius had won. ===Results=== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 80%;" |- ! colspan="9" style="background-color: #ccf; color: #000080; text-align: center;" | Polaris 8 |- ! The card was headlined by a catchweight superfight between the multiple-time MMA champion Jake Shields and future Bellator MMA Middleweight Champion and grappling champion Rafael Lovato Jr. In the co-featured slot, for inaugural the Polaris Ladies Under 55KG Championship a bout between IBJJF(2018) champion Ffion Davies and IBJJF(2013/2014/2016) champion Gezary Matuda took place. Bonus awards The following fighters were awarded bonuses: * Performance of the Night: Ffion Davies * Submission of the Night: Ethan Crelinsten ===Results=== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 80%;" |- ! However, Edwin Najmi stepping up on short notice to face Khera. Marc Diakiese has had to pull out of his match with Chris Fishgold, however, Diakiese's training partner and grappling instructor, Liam Cann, will be stepping in on short notice to test himself against the powerful UFC grappler. Unfortunately due to a last minute training injury, Satoshi Ishii is unable to compete and so the match with Arya Esfandmaz will have to be postponed. ===Results=== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 80%;" |- ! Unfortunately, Hlali has been unable to compete. Williams instead faced Richard Alarcon, who stepped in on a weeks notice for this encounter. ===Fight Card=== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 80%;" |- ! colspan="9" style="background- color: #ccf; color: #000080; text-align: center;" | Polaris 12 |- ! colspan="1" style="background-color: #E6E8FA; color: #000000; text-align: center;" | Notes |- |Lightweight 70.3 kg |NO-GI | Ashley Williams (c) |vs. | AJ Agazarm | |align=center| |align=center| |For the Polaris Lightweight Championship |} ==Polaris Squads== ===Background=== Polaris Squads is an upcoming event that will feature two teams of eight grapplers, four under 75 kg and four under 95 kg on each team. They will be competing across an eighty-minute time period, split into two halves.https://jitsmagazine.com/rules-and-first-competitor-announced-for- polaris-squads/ The first event of its kind to use this unique ruleset, it sees UFC veterans and elite BJJ black belts representing Team UK and Ireland,https://jitsmagazine.com/full-polaris-squads-team-uk-and-ireland- lineup-announced/ and Team Europe.https://jitsmagazine.com/polaris-squads- lineup-finalized-with-team-europe-announcement/ The event will also feature a non-title superfight between Ffion Davies and Magdalena Loska.https://jitsmagazine.com/polaris-squads-adds-ffion-davies-v-magdalena- loska-superfight/ ===Team UK and Ireland=== ====-75kg==== Ashley Williams Tom Halpin Dominic Dillon Jed Hue ====-95kg==== Darragh O'Connail Bradley Hill Kieran Davern Taylor Pearman ===Team Europe=== ====-75kg==== Mateusz Szczecisnki Tommi Pulkkanen Kamil Wilk Dinu Bucalet ====-95kg==== Eduardo 'Teta' Rios Marcin Held Tarik Hopstock Santeri Lilius ===Results=== After a total of sixteen matches, Team UK & Ireland won the event 1–0. Fifteen of the matches ended in a draw and double-elimination, with the only submission coming from Tom Halpin. He submitted Dinu Bucalet via Triangle Choke late in the first half. The main event superfight saw Ffion Davies defeat Magdalena Loska via Rear-Naked Choke.https://jitsmagazine.com/polaris-squads-live- results-discussion-and-play-by-play/ == See also == * Metamoris * ADCC Submission Wrestling World Championship ==References== ==External links== * Category:Brazilian jiu-jitsu competitions Category:Grappling competitions Category:2015 establishments in the United Kingdom Category:Sports leagues established in 2015
